item.title: Angie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Angie add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Angie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Angie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Angie add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Angie add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Angie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Angie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Angie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Angie add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Angie add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Angie add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Angie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Angie add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Angie add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Angie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Angie add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Angie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Angie add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Angie add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Angie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Angie add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Angie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Angie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Angie add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Angie add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Angie add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
